SEARCH
Package com.simcraft.managers

Class SoundManager

java.lang.Object
com.simcraft.managers.SoundManager
public class SoundManager extends Object
Manages audio playback for the game using a singleton pattern.

The SoundManager loads, plays, and stops audio clips efficiently. Audio files can be loaded either from the JAR's resources or as external files.

      Checks if a given sound clip (by key) is currently playing.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      true if the clip is currently running, false otherwise.

    • loadClipFromAudioFile

      public static Clip loadClipFromAudioFile(String filePath, String key) throws IllegalArgumentException, IOException, UnsupportedAudioFileException, LineUnavailableException
      Loads an audio clip from a specified file path.

      If the audio file is bundled in the JAR (or the classpath), it is loaded using a URL. Otherwise, it is loaded as a regular file.

      The file must be a valid audio format supported by AudioSystem.

      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the audio file (relative to classpath or absolute).
      key - The key associated with this audio clip.
      Returns:
      A Clip instance containing the loaded audio.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the file path is empty or null.
      IOException - If there is an error reading the file or it does not exist.
      UnsupportedAudioFileException - If the audio format is not supported.
      LineUnavailableException - If no audio line is available for playback.

    • playClip

      public void playClip(String key, boolean looping)
      Plays a sound clip with the current global volume..
      Parameters:
      key - The key of the sound clip.
      looping - If true, the sound will loop continuously.

    • playClip

      public void playClip(String key, boolean looping, float volume)
      Plays a sound clip with a custom volume level.
      Parameters:
      key - The key of the sound clip.
      looping - If true, the sound will loop continuously.
      volume - The volume level for this playback (range: 0.0 to 1.0).

    • stopClip

      public void stopClip(String key)
      Stops a specific sound clip.

    • stopAll

      Stops all currently playing sound clips.
